channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
In Opinion
“It will be impossible to do anything about guns in this country, at least at a national level, as long as Democrats depend on the cooperation of a party that holds in reserve the possibility of insurrection,” Michelle Goldberg writes. https://t.co/EojmfvY7Ix

New photos from The Uvalde Leader-News shared with The New York Times show that children escaped through the windows on Tuesday after a gunman opened fire in their school, killing 19 children and two teachers.
Updates on the Texas school shooting: https://t.co/zZTQarWpAZ https://t.co/DpSFlD72s1

Four House Republicans including Representative Kevin McCarthy, the minority leader, signaled on Thursday that they would not cooperate with subpoenas from the committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol. https://t.co/W99bnMsR6s
Breaking News: A federal judge dismissed Donald Trump’s lawsuit seeking to halt the New York attorney general’s civil investigation into his business practices. https://t.co/P3PkrCVLqb

Russian forces want to burn cities in Ukraine’s east “to ashes,” President Volodymyr Zelensky said. He accused Moscow of a genocide and criticized the world for not acting earlier to stem its aggression. https://t.co/UmYmV4RLgo
Breaking News: Border Patrol agents arrived far earlier than disclosed, but the Uvalde police initially kept them from entering the school, two officials said. https://t.co/n70TuFLqS5
Amber Heard took the stand on Thursday to address what she described as the persistent harassment and mockery of her abuse accusations against Johnny Depp, her ex-husband. https://t.co/JnTJ866LYc

Daniel Defense, the company that made the rifle the gunman used on Tuesday to kill 21 people inside an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, received a $3.1 million loan from the federal government in April 2020 through the Paycheck Protection Program. https://t.co/jPXwdjsqDH

Ray Liotta's performance as Henry Hill in "Goodfellas" injected a note of tenderness that’s all the more effective for coming out of the mouth of a slick sociopath. But the producer didn’t want to cast him originally. https://t.co/SIvruI0KTH

Russia is inciting genocide in Ukraine, a new report by legal scholars and human rights experts said.
Mass killings, attacks on shelters or evacuation routes, and the shelling of residential areas established a “genocidal pattern,” the report found. https://t.co/lb3XB3m7Ti

The Yankees and the Rays are not posting about tonight’s game on social media. Instead, they are highlighting facts about gun violence. “There are things that are bigger than baseball,” said Jason Zillo, the Yankees’ vice president of communications. https://t.co/1TxOxU4xPH

“The other contagion”: Covid misinformation and vaccine-bashing from pundits like Tucker Carlson has radicalized a wave of parents into rejecting ordinary childhood immunizations and vaccines they previously accepted — with potentially lethal consequences. https://t.co/geSnRcE6p8

Joe Garcia, the husband of Irma Garcia, one of the two teachers killed in the Uvalde massacre at Robb Elementary School, died on Thursday of a heart attack, his nephew said. The couple had been married for 24 years and had four children. https://t.co/z5Y9hXtQ8b
Several musical performers who planned to appear at this week’s NRA convention in Houston have withdrawn out of respect for the victims of the massacre in Uvalde. https://t.co/EaHIhDbDw2

After the deadliest school shooting in a decade, a small group of Republican and Democratic senators have begun an urgent and uphill effort to strike a compromise on new gun laws. https://t.co/OIFUNUKNDG

The Yankees and the Rays are not posting about tonight’s game on social media. Instead, they are highlighting facts about gun violence. “There are things that are bigger than baseball,” said Jason Zillo, the Yankees’ vice president of communications. https://t.co/47RX7fkWnW

“Everyone was scared and everything, and I told them to be quiet.”
Gemma Lopez, 10, was in class at Robb Elementary School on Tuesday when she heard gunfire. Years of drills taught her what to do next: she turned off the lights and huddled under a table. https://t.co/D43YyJtgf6

“Our baby wanted to be a lawyer; she wanted to make a difference,” Kimberly Rubio said of her daughter Alexandria “Lexi” Aniyah Rubio, 10, who was killed in the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas. “Please make sure she makes one now.” https://t.co/01fG4mC7UK

Five GOP candidates for Michigan governor were disqualified from the ballot for submitting petitions that officials said contained thousands of forged signatures, sending the party's effort to challenge Gov. Gretchen Whitmer into chaos. https://t.co/PtTfTs05OJ

Families of the victims of the Uvalde shooting have criticized the police response, suggesting there was a delay. Officials say they are still investigating the sequence of events.
Follow the latest updates from Uvalde, Texas. https://t.co/HMCrYwjQ2q https://t.co/0G2QgwYbZ3

Daniel Defense, the company that made the rifle the gunman used on Tuesday to kill 21 people inside an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, received a $3.1 million loan from the federal government in April 2020 through the Paycheck Protection Program. https://t.co/eGuGBgg9ul

The gunman who killed 19 children and two adults in Uvalde, Texas, walked freely into the elementary school, a state police official said on Thursday, disputing initial reports that the gunman was confronted by a school district police officer. https://t.co/LnGwo6nSQj

At a police briefing in Uvalde, Texas, on Thursday, investigators were not able to answer why it took more than an hour to breach a classroom and kill the gunman who massacred 19 children and two teachers at Robb Elementary School.
Live updates: https://t.co/zLKRVX2FFa

Joe Garcia, the husband of Irma Garcia, one of the two teachers killed in the Uvalde massacre at Robb Elementary School, died on Thursday of a heart attack, his nephew said. The couple had been married for 24 years and had four children. https://t.co/tvLzZAiT0T

Gustavo Petro could soon become Colombia's first leftist president, a watershed moment for one of Latin America's most politically conservative societies.
His ascent has been propelled by the biggest, loudest youth electorate in the country's history. https://t.co/HAHvT0Rwi9

The leaders of the two largest teachers’ unions in the U.S. are making plans to travel to Houston to protest the NRA convention set to open on Friday.
Follow the latest updates from Uvalde, Texas: https://t.co/aWrPZuIFYn

The New York Times reached out to all 50 Republicans in the Senate to see whether they would support a pair of House-passed measures to strengthen background checks for gun buyers. Here are some of their responses. https://t.co/b9T2IQMJW5 https://t.co/rb13uZt6yK

Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr. and Ivanka Trump must all sit for questioning under oath as part of the New York attorney general’s civil investigation into their business practices, a state appeals court ruled on Thursday. https://t.co/ah0sUfuhCJ
Senate Republicans blocked a domestic terrorism bill Democrats put forward following the racist massacre that killed 10 Black people in Buffalo. https://t.co/D09vhsvw81

Breaking News: Ray Liotta, the actor known for roles in “Goodfellas,” “Field of Dreams” and other films, died in the Dominican Republic, where he was filming a movie. He was 67. https://t.co/h7vZlgjk8z https://t.co/JgYIypn3MX

Javier Cazares, whose 9-year-old daughter was killed at Robb Elementary, said officials have been misrepresenting the response of law enforcement during the shooting. He said he didn’t understand why the officers were "just standing out there" for so long. https://t.co/x6plLZIEnw

The gunman who killed 19 children and two teachers at Robb Elementary was inside the school for roughly an hour before a tactical unit from the Border Patrol shot and killed him, according to the director of the Texas Department of Public Safety. https://t.co/Nl3dDhggah

Parents of students who were trapped inside Robb Elementary School furiously urged police to storm the school sooner, according to a witness who was there on the day of the shooting. "The dads were saying, 'Give me the vest, I’ll go in there!'" https://t.co/TXGQpkMLlv

After the mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas, The New York Times asked all 50 Republicans in the Senate whether they would support measures to strengthen background checks for gun buyers.
Here's where they stand. https://t.co/qqYJLCNdVm

Jimmy Carter, at 97, is stepping into a big environmental fight over a small road in Alaska. At stake is the future of a law that the 39th president called one of his highest achievements. https://t.co/K11KQkPXrL

In the aftermath of Tuesday’s school massacre in Uvalde, Texas, where a gunman killed 19 children and two teachers, Senator Ted Cruz remained unapologetic in his broad opposition to gun control measures. https://t.co/xS92oY1MIJ

Britain, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, Norway: All these countries had a culture of gun ownership, and they all tightened restrictions after mass shootings.
Only the U.S. has so consistently refused to reform gun laws, Max Fisher writes. https://t.co/Vfb1I0Swhk

A mother recalled Eva Mireles, a teacher at Robb Elementary School who was killed in the shooting in Uvalde, Texas, as transformational in her daughter's life. “She was just above and beyond as far as teachers go.” https://t.co/g9Xe8h2jSs

Irma Garcia, a teacher, was killed in the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas. She was like a "second mom" to her students, her nephew said.
"She’s always been optimistic about everything, and just so loving with the people in her life." https://t.co/c6pkxBr33W

Honor roll students, two cousins, a teacher who brought the neighborhood together: Here’s what we know about the victims of the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas. https://t.co/vmntP9HheM https://t.co/673o4mPrb6
The U.S. is in the middle of a gun-buying boom that shows no sign of letting up as the annual number of firearms manufactured has nearly tripled since 2000. https://t.co/f4qeuBovGi

The front page of The New York Times for May 26, 2022.
Follow our updates on the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas. https://t.co/yZQA0TuQL0 https://t.co/ldwxNlQh07

Gov. Kevin Stitt of Oklahoma signed a bill into law on Wednesday that bans nearly all abortions starting at fertilization. The new law, expected to take effect immediately, is the most restrictive abortion ban in the U.S. https://t.co/P7cB0qmpsn

Joe Costilla extended his arms and allowed George Rodriguez to fall out of the truck and into his hug. “I lost two,” Rodriguez said in between sobs. “My grandson and a niece. I lost two.”
“I know, I know,” his friend responded. “We lost our cousin, too.” https://t.co/479uas1hCk

La noche anterior al tiroteo en Uvalde, Jailah Silguero, de 10 años, le dijo a su papá que no quería ir a la escuela al día siguiente. Jailah fue una las 21 personas asesinadas el martes en Texas.
Esto es lo que sabemos sobre ellas. https://t.co/zeFco03yOU https://t.co/Q9ePmXyj8T

Breaking News: In a major breakthrough, scientists used a technique called quantum teleportation to send data across three physical locations, taking a significant step toward the computer network of the future. https://t.co/LXYcKe7DBH

Donald Trump barreled into Georgia vowing to marshal voters against his enemies and punish Republicans who crossed him in 2020. Instead, Georgia voters punished him for meddling in their state. https://t.co/1Hv6ZPpO9b

Parents waiting in agony for news about their children were asked by authorities to provide DNA samples, suggesting that some of the 19 children who were killed in the Uvalde shooting may have been so severely wounded that they were difficult to identify. https://t.co/2J9MJc6zpu

In Opinion
“The United States must treat the easy access to semiautomatic weapons as the national security threat it is,” writes Mary McCord, a former U.S. national security official, in a guest essay. https://t.co/rd3ep8Uzr6

Jackie Cazares and Annabelle Rodriguez were cousins in the same classroom at Robb Elementary School. Amerie Jo Garza loved Play-Doh. And Xavier Lopez made the honor roll on the day he was killed.
Here’s what we know about the victims so far. https://t.co/0rUzt1Qbmg https://t.co/nMk4uUr21f
